result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel M Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CONCURRENT
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2023 @ 1:30pm, Br-29

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample as to counts 1 & 2; pay surcharge. Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges during the course of probation, civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
- Restitution set at zero.

Court advised defendant he may never possess firearm, body armor, explosives or ammunition. Court advised defendant his voting rights are suspended until the completion of probation and his civil rights are restored.

- Commit no further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with IAR, MAR and DSR until a course in Anger Management has been completed and approved by Agent. Further, the children must express mutual desire for contact, otherwise there shall be no contact.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.

- Cooperate with Agent regarding home and office visits.
- Attend Parenting Classes.
- Mental Health Evaluation; comply with any treatment.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With release for work, job search and all reasons deemed appropriate by the HOC.
IMPOSED AND STAYED; pending review hearing.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 1; with credit for 133 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel M Rivera

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel M Rivera in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Samuel M Rivera.  Assistant District Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Sentencing hearing.  Court reviewed character reference Letters, State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42 MONTHS, with credit for 133 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2:
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42 MONTHS, CONCURRENT with Count 1, with credit for 133 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS 

Court found Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. (prison)
Court found Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. (prison)
 
COURT IMPOSED AND STAYED THE SENTENCE ON Amended COUNTS 1 & 2, AND PLACED DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF 3 YEARS, CONCURRENT.

- As to Count 1: Serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with release for work, job search and all reasons deemed appropriate by the House of Correction.
- As to Count 1:  Court imposed 60 Condition Days STAYED pending review hearing.
- Commit no further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with agent regarding home and office visits.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with IAR, MAR and DSR until a course in anger management has been completed and approved by agent.
   Further, the children must express mutual desire for contact, otherwise there shall be no contact.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide DNA sample as to counts 1 & 2 and pay surcharge.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; during the course of probation, civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Court advised defendant he may never possess firearm, body armor, explosives or ammunition.
Court advised defendant his voting rights are suspended until the completion of probation and his civil rights are restored.
The Review Hearing is scheduled on Feb. 3, 2023 at 1:30 before Judge Rebecca Kiefer (Rm 502 of the Court House)

Received and filed: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Case set for a sentencing hearing. Branch 29 is unavailable. Case spun to Branch 45, Judge Kies. Parties sent to CJF G55.
on behalf of defendant, filed.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Samuel M Rivera.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Bail/bond hearing held. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court sets matter for a sentencing hearing in Branch 29.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Samuel M Rivera.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a jury trial. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Instructions, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
State's Recommendation, filed.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin appeared by video for Samuel M Rivera.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 09/12/2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Samuel M Rivera not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. Defendant not produced. Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied bail motion for todays purposes. Defense further requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Samuel M Rivera not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared on behalf of Katherine Seelow for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defese counsel requests Bail Review date. Court grants request and adjourns matter for a Bail Bond Hearing to Br 29.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29.
Defendant Samuel M Rivera in court, appear by video with attorney Michael L. Chernin, appear by video.  Defendant Samuel M Rivera in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with IAR (02/22/2007), MAR (07/18/2010), and DSR (11/10/2012)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Samuel M Rivera in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Samuel M Rivera in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samuel M Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
